body.p: Negative feedback occurs when environmental conditions move the body away from optimal conditions. For example as your body cools below 37 degrees Celsius the control center in your brain signals that actions need to be taken to raise your body temperature. The muscular system will begin to act. The smooth muscle of the blood vessels in the extremities will constrict and shut the blood to the important organs.

multiple_choice.choice: The feeling of hyperthermia in your extremities.
One reason that frost bite occurs on fingers and nose first.
The occurrence of varicose veins in the legs.
The excessive thirst you feel when you are hot.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Hyperthermia is the result of too much heat. The warm blood would be moved to your important organs and away from your extremities.
Correct. Your fingers, toes and nose are most likely to experience frost bite from cold first.
Incorrect. Varicose veins are the result of faulty valves in your legs.
Incorrect. Your thirst does not have anything to do with the blood being shunted to your important organs.

part.hint: You can live without your fingers. Cellular respiration is an aerobic process and the equation is normally written as C 6 H 12 O 6 + 6O 2 yields 6CO 2 + 6H 2 O + ATP.

question.body: Explain in your own words why the equation for aerobic cellular metabolism C 6 H 12 O 6 + 6O 2 yields 6CO 2 + 6H 2 O + ATP + heat includes both ATP and heat as a product.

part.explanation: This is because no conversion of energy is ever 100% efficient, so not all of the energy in the glucose becomes ATP. The excess energy is released as the by product of heat. So, the heat generated from aerobic cellular metabolism becomes part of your body's temperature homeostasis, and can be increased from shivering when your body is trying to make heat to warm up.

question.body: How is an astronaut like a person with a bone in a cast?

multiple_choice.choice: They are both putting less stress on their muscles and they may atrophy.
They are both putting more stress on their muscles and they may atrophy.
The atrophy of their muscles is irreversible.
The hypertrophy of these muscles is irreversible.

response.feedback: Correct. Muscles can atrophy because of disuse.
Incorrect. In both of these cases the person is putting less stress on their muscles.
Incorrect. The atrophy of muscles through disuse is usually reversible through exercise.
Incorrect. The muscles in these situations would atrophy not experience hypertrophy.

question.body: A three time Tour de France winner tested positive for a drug that is considered evidence of blood doping. Blood doping increases the amount of red blood cells in the body. Why would this be an advantage to an athlete?

multiple_choice.choice: The increase in red blood cells will increase the amount of time it takes the muscles to recover.
The increase in red blood cells will allow the muscles to undergo aerobic respiration longer.
The increase in red blood cells will allow the muscles to undergo anaerobic respiration longer.
The increase in red blood cells will decrease the amount of ATP produced.

response.feedback: Incorrect. An increase in red blood cells will increase the oxygen which will decrease the recovery time.
Correct. An increase in red blood cells will increase the oxygen which can increase the amount of aerobic respiration.
Incorrect. An increase in red blood cells will increase the oxygen which can increase the amount of aerobic respiration.
Incorrect. An increase in red blood cells will increase the oxygen which can increase the amount of ATP produced.

part.hint: The function of red blood cells is to carry oxygen.
